text: Terence David Hands (9 January 1941 - 4 February 2020) was an English theatre director. He founded the Liverpool Everyman Theatre and ran the Royal Shakespeare Company for thirteen years. He also saved Clwyd Theatr Cymru from closure. He was thought to be one of Britainâ€™s most respected theatre directors. He was born in Aldershot, Hampshire. Hands died on 4 February 2020 at the age of 79. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:English entertainers Category:People from Hampshire
title: Terry Hands
